intro: Eugenia cephalophora, commonly known as the helmet eugenia, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the rainforests of northern Queensland, Australia, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. Its fruit, which is small and capsule-like, contains several seeds. Eugenia cephalophora is often found growing in dense understorey vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
